column4: hi wanted to know what peoples thoughts on ubuntu 11.04 and how they would rate it compared to 10.10 which i am currently on, don't know if i should update yet?
never touch a running system
yeah but i updated from 9.1 to 10.04 to 10.10 using the upgrade manager
worked well with no problems
and why you need an upgrade?
no i wanted to find out if 11.04 was better than 10.10, i mean i thought the new version of ubuntu the better it is
better is always a personal opinion
okay you got me thinking i should just stay with 10.10 which runs fantastic on my ibm thinkpad t60
as i said, never touch a running system :) the most important sentence out there
i know i will just test 11.04 through virtualbox and see if its really as good, then will do back up and then do install
no
not when deleted from the shell by "rm"
as i said, delete data cant be restored

its an external hard drive so that is a mechanical hard drive, but the problem is that it had the files on the hard drive and one day when hard drive was plugged in, the files weren't there, actually empty
the best way to recover your data is your backup
backup, can u back up a external hard drive? b/c I would do that in the future to save my data
of course you can backup it
there is no differene of internal drive, external drive, flash drive, streamer, floppy and so when doing a backup from it
correct
